Description

(Italy/US, 2011) Directed by John Turturro. With: Max Casella, Lina Sastri, M’Barka Ben Taleb, James Senese, John Turturro. “There are places that you go to, and once is enough. And then there is Napoli.” - John Turturro. Much more than a simple tour guide, actor/director Turturro walks the streets and beaches of Napoli to capture its delightful music on film - much as Wim Wenders and Ry Cooder turned the world on to Havana’s forgotten musical scene in Buena Vista Social Club. A huge hit in Italy, Passione explores a surprising culture with diverse roots in North Africa, Spain, France, and the U.S., which have magically come together to create something new: a soulful mix of canzone Napoletana, jazz, pop, opera, and fado. Treat yourself to the pleasurable antidote to the cold nights to come! “Passione is a surprise and a delight from beginning to end.” Stephen Rea, Philadelphia Inquirer.

 

Tickets can be purchased from the ticket booth, beginning a half hour before the start of all shows.

  • Admission with Friends of Cinestudio Card: $7.00
  • Admission for Seniors over 62: $7.00
  • Students from any school, with student ID: $7.00
